title: SatixFy handed stock exchange delisting warning
summary: SatixFy is the latest space firm to face being kicked off a stock exchange after shares plummeted following a merger with a Special Purpose Acquisition Company (SPAC), a fast-track alternative to traditional initial public offerings of stock.

title: Industry report: Demand for satellites is rising but not skyrocketing
summary: A new report predicts that around 20,000 new satellites will launch by the end of the decade — a more conservative forecast compared to other sky-high projections.

title: York reveals latest commercial space-as-a-service mission
summary: York Space Systems established contact within three hours of the Dec. 1 launch of a commercial space-as-a-service mission for CACI International.

title: What happens in Vega didn’t stay in Vega, as key rocket parts went missing
summary: There's a valuable payload riding on the final Vega rocket launch.

title: The Case of the Missing Vega AVUM Propellant Tanks
summary:
Two of the four tanks necessary to power the fourth stage of the final Vega flight disappeared several months ago, leaving Avio scrambling to find an alternate solution. The Vega AVUM fourth stage stands at 1.74 meters tall with a diameter of 1.9 meters. The stage is equipped with the Ukrainian RD-869 UDMH/NTO liquid-fueled engine. […]
The post The Case of the Missing Vega AVUM Propellant Tanks appeared first on European Spaceflight.
